thread.title: Corinthian Colleges Debt Claims Swell as Totals Could Reach 350,000
thread.title_full: Corinthian Colleges Debt Claims Swell as Totals Could Reach 350,000

title: Corinthian Colleges Debt Claims Swell as Totals Could Reach 350,000
text:
Corinthian Colleges Debt Claims Swell as Totals Could Reach 350,000 Written by: John Sandman 09/08/15 - 11:11 AM EDT 
NEW YORK ( MainStreet ) — There is strength in numbers. Ask former Corinthian College students who are demanding that the Department of Education (ED) write off their student loans . 
In June, the number of students filing claims to have their loans discharged reached 4,140. By the end of August, an additional 7,815 claims were made for debt relief, raising the total to almost 12,000. 
The students’ claims are based on what’s known as a "borrower's defense," part of a higher ed law which allows for students who think they were fraud victims to have their loans forgiven. More Headlines
